verses.verse: Now Jephthah <WH3316> the Gileadite <WH1569> was a valiant <WH2428> warrior, <WH1368> but he was the son <WH1121> of a harlot. <WH802> <WH2181> And Gilead <WH1568> was the father <WH3205> of Jephthah. <WH3316>

And Gilead's wife <WH802> bore <WH3205> him sons; <WH1121> and when his wife's sons <WH1121> grew <WH1431> up, they drove <WH1644> Jephthah <WH3316> out and said <WH559> to him, "You shall not have <WH5157> an inheritance <WH5157> in our father's house, <WH1004> for you are the son <WH1121> of another <WH312> woman. <WH802>"

So Jephthah <WH3316> fled <WH1272> from his brothers <WH251> and lived <WH3427> in the land <WH776> of Tob; <WH2897> and worthless <WH7386> fellows <WH376> gathered <WH3950> themselves about <WH413> Jephthah, <WH3316> and they went <WH3318> out with him.
And it came <WH1961> about after <WH4480> a while <WH3117> that the sons <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> fought <WH3898> against <WH5973> Israel. <WH3478>

And it happened <WH1961> when <WH9201> the sons <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> fought <WH3898> against <WH5973> Israel <WH3478> that the elders <WH2205> of Gilead <WH1568> went <WH1980> to get <WH3947> Jephthah <WH3316> from the land <WH776> of Tob; <WH2897>
and they said <WH559> to Jephthah, <WH3316> "Come <WH1980> and be our chief <WH7101> that we may fight <WH3898> against the sons <WH1121> of Ammon. <WH5983>"

Then Jephthah <WH3316> said <WH559> to the elders <WH2205> of Gilead, <WH1568> "Did you not hate <WH8130> me and drive <WH1644> me from my father's house <WH1004>? So why <WH4069> have you come <WH935> to me now <WH6258> when <WH9201> you are in trouble <WH9503>?"

And the elders <WH2205> of Gilead <WH1568> said <WH559> to Jephthah, <WH3316> "For this <WH3651> reason <WH3651> we have now <WH6258> returned <WH7725> to you, that you may go <WH1980> with us and fight <WH3898> with the sons <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> and become <WH1961> head <WH7218> over all <WH3605> the inhabitants <WH3427> of Gilead. <WH1568>"

So Jephthah <WH3316> said <WH559> to the elders <WH2205> of Gilead, <WH1568> "If <WH518> you take <WH7725> me back <WH7725> to fight <WH3898> against the sons <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> and the Lord <WH3068> gives <WH5414> them up to me, will I become <WH1961> your head <WH7218>?"

And the elders <WH2205> of Gilead <WH1568> said <WH559> to Jephthah, <WH3316> "The Lord <WH3068> is witness <WH8085> between <WH996> us; surely <WH518> <WH3808> we will do <WH6213> as you have said. <WH1697>"

Then Jephthah <WH3316> went <WH1980> with the elders <WH2205> of Gilead, <WH1568> and the people <WH5971> made <WH7760> him head <WH7218> and chief <WH7101> over <WH5921> them; and Jephthah <WH3316> spoke <WH1696> all <WH3605> his words <WH1697> before <WH6440> the Lord <WH3068> at Mizpah. <WH4709>

Now Jephthah <WH3316> sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> to the king <WH4428> of the sons <WH1121> of Ammon, <WH5983> saying, <WH559> "What <WH4100> is between you and me, that you have come <WH935> to me to fight <WH3898> against my land <WH776>?"

And the king <WH4428> of the sons <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> said <WH559> to the messengers <WH4397> of Jephthah, <WH3316> "Because <WH3588> Israel <WH3478> took <WH3947> away my land <WH776> when they came <WH5927> up from Egypt, <WH4714> from the Arnon <WH769> as far <WH5704> as the Jabbok <WH2999> and the Jordan; <WH3383> therefore, return <WH7725> them peaceably <WH7965> now. <WH6258>"
But Jephthah <WH3316> sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> again <WH5750> <WH3254> to the king <WH4428> of the sons <WH1121> of Ammon, <WH5983>

and they said <WH559> to him, "Thus <WH3541> says <WH559> Jephthah, <WH3316> 'Israel <WH3478> did not take <WH3947> away the land <WH776> of Moab, <WH4124> nor <WH3808> the land <WH776> of the sons <WH1121> of Ammon. <WH5983>
'For when they came <WH5927> up from Egypt, <WH4714> and Israel <WH3478> went <WH1980> through the wilderness <WH4057> to the Red <WH5488> <WH3220> Sea <WH3220> and came <WH935> to Kadesh, <WH6946>

then Israel <WH3478> sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> to the king <WH4428> of Edom, <WH9000> saying, <WH559> "Please <WH4994> let us pass <WH5674> through your land, <WH776>" but the king <WH4428> of Edom <WH9000> would not listen. <WH8085> And they also <WH1571> sent <WH7971> to the king <WH4428> of Moab, <WH4124> but he would not consent. <WH14> So Israel <WH3478> remained <WH3427> at Kadesh. <WH6946>

'Then they went <WH1980> through the wilderness <WH4057> and around <WH5437> the land <WH776> of Edom <WH9000> and the land <WH776> of Moab, <WH4124> and came <WH935> to the east <WH4217> <WH8121> side <WH4217> <WH8121> of the land <WH776> of Moab, <WH4124> and they camped <WH2583> beyond <WH5676> the Arnon; <WH769> but they did not enter <WH935> the territory <WH1366> of Moab, <WH4124> for the Arnon <WH769> [was] the border <WH1366> of Moab. <WH4124>

'And Israel <WH3478> sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> to Sihon <WH5511> king <WH4428> of the Amorites, <WH567> the king <WH4428> of Heshbon, <WH2809> and Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> to him, "Please <WH4994> let us pass <WH5674> through your land <WH776> to our place. <WH4725>"

'But Sihon <WH5511> did not trust <WH539> Israel <WH3478> to pass <WH5674> through his territory; <WH1366> so Sihon <WH5511> gathered <WH622> all <WH3605> his people <WH5971> and camped <WH2583> in Jahaz, <WH3096> and fought <WH3898> with Israel. <WH3478>

'And the Lord, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> gave <WH5414> Sihon <WH5511> and all <WH3605> his people <WH5971> into the hand <WH3027> of Israel, <WH3478> and they defeated <WH5221> them; so Israel <WH3478> possessed <WH3423> all <WH3605> the land <WH776> of the Amorites, <WH567> the inhabitants <WH3427> of that country. <WH776>

'So they possessed <WH3423> all <WH3605> the territory <WH1366> of the Amorites, <WH567> from the Arnon <WH769> as far <WH5704> as the Jabbok, <WH2999> and from the wilderness <WH4057> as far <WH5704> as the Jordan. <WH3383>

'Since now <WH6258> the Lord, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> drove <WH3423> out the Amorites <WH567> from before <WH6440> His people <WH5971> Israel, <WH3478> are you then to possess <WH3423> it?

'Do you not possess <WH3423> what <WH834> Chemosh <WH3645> your god <WH430> gives <WH3423> you to possess <WH3423>? So whatever <WH3605> <WH834> the Lord <WH3068> our God <WH430> has driven <WH3423> out before <WH4480> <WH6440> us, we will possess <WH3423> it.

'And now <WH6258> are you any <WH2895> better <WH2896> than <WH4480> Balak <WH1111> the son <WH1121> of Zippor, <WH6834> king <WH4428> of Moab <WH4124>? Did he ever <WH7378> strive <WH7378> with Israel, <WH3478> or <WH518> did he ever <WH3898> fight <WH3898> against them?

'While Israel <WH3478> lived <WH3427> in Heshbon <WH2809> and its villages, <WH1323> and in Aroer <WH6177> and its villages, <WH1323> and in all <WH3605> the cities <WH5892> that are on the banks <WH3027> of the Arnon, <WH769> three <WH7969> hundred <WH3967> years, <WH8141> why <WH4069> did you not recover <WH5337> them within that time <WH6256>?

'I therefore have not sinned <WH2398> against you, but you are doing <WH6213> me wrong <WH9567> by making <WH3898> war <WH3898> against me; may the Lord, <WH3068> the Judge, <WH8199> judge <WH8199> today <WH3117> between <WH996> the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> and the sons <WH1121> of Ammon. <WH5983>' "
But the king <WH4428> of the sons <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> disregarded <WH3808> <WH8085> the message <WH1697> which <WH834> Jephthah <WH3316> sent <WH7971> him.

Now the Spirit <WH7307> of the Lord <WH3068> came <WH1961> upon Jephthah, <WH3316> so that he passed <WH5674> through <WH5674> Gilead <WH1568> and Manasseh; <WH4519> then he passed <WH5674> through <WH5674> Mizpah <WH4708> of Gilead, <WH1568> and from Mizpah <WH4708> of Gilead <WH1568> he went <WH5674> on to the sons <WH1121> of Ammon. <WH5983>

And Jephthah <WH3316> made <WH5087> a vow <WH5088> to the Lord <WH3068> and said, <WH559> "If <WH518> Thou wilt indeed <WH5414> give <WH5414> the sons <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> into my hand, <WH3027>

then it shall be that whatever <WH834> comes <WH3318> out of the doors <WH1817> of my house <WH1004> to meet <WH7122> me when I return <WH7725> in peace <WH7965> from the sons <WH1121> of Ammon, <WH5983> it shall be the Lord's, and I will offer <WH5927> it up as a burnt <WH5930> offering. <WH5930> "
So Jephthah <WH3316> crossed <WH5674> over <WH5674> to the sons <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> to fight <WH3898> against them; and the Lord <WH3068> gave <WH5414> them into his hand. <WH3027>

And he struck <WH5221> them with a very <WH3966> great <WH1419> slaughter <WH4347> from Aroer <WH6177> to the entrance <WH935> of Minnith, <WH4511> twenty <WH6242> cities, <WH5892> and as far <WH5704> as Abel-keramim. So the sons <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> were subdued <WH3665> before <WH4480> <WH6440> the sons <WH1121> of Israel. <WH3478>

When Jephthah <WH3316> came <WH935> to his house <WH1004> at Mizpah, <WH4709> behold, <WH2009> his daughter <WH1323> was coming <WH3318> out to meet <WH7122> him with tambourines <WH8596> and with dancing. <WH4246> Now she was his one <WH3173> [and] only <WH7534> child; <WH3173> besides <WH4480> her he had <WH369> neither <WH369> son <WH1121> nor <WH176> daughter. <WH1323>

And it came <WH1961> about when he saw <WH7200> her, that he tore <WH7167> his clothes <WH899> and said, <WH559> "Alas, <WH162> my daughter! <WH1323> You have brought <WH3766> me very <WH3766> low, <WH3766> and you are among those who trouble <WH5916> me; for I have given <WH6475> my word <WH6310> to the Lord, <WH3068> and I cannot <WH3201> <WH3808> take <WH7725> [it] back. <WH7725>"

So she said <WH559> to him, "My father, you have given <WH1> your word <WH6475> to the Lord; <WH6310> do <WH3068> to me as you have said <WH6213>, <WH3318> <WH4480> since <WH6310> <WH310> the Lord <WH834> has avenged <WH3068> you of your enemies, <WH5360> the sons <WH340> of Ammon. <WH1121>"

And she said <WH559> to her father, "Let this <WH1> thing <WH2088> be done <WH1697> for me; let <WH6213> me alone <WH7503> <WH4480> two <WH7503> months, <WH8147> that I may go <WH2320> <WH1980> to the mountains <WH3381> and weep <WH2022> because <WH1058> of my virginity, <WH5921> I and my companions. <WH1331>"

Then he said, <WH559> "Go. <WH1980>" So he sent <WH7971> her away <WH7971> for two <WH8147> months; <WH2320> and she left <WH1980> with her companions, <WH7464> and wept <WH1058> on the mountains <WH2022> because <WH5921> of her virginity. <WH1331>

And it came <WH1961> about at the end <WH7093> of two <WH8147> months <WH2320> that she returned <WH7725> to her father, who did <WH1> to her according to the vow <WH6213> which <WH5088> he had made; <WH834> and she had <WH5087> no <WH3045> relations <WH3808> with a man. <WH3045> Thus it became <WH376> a custom <WH1961> in Israel, <WH2706>

that the daughters <WH1323> of Israel <WH3478> went <WH1980> yearly <WH3117> to commemorate <WH8567> the daughter <WH1323> of Jephthah <WH3316> the Gileadite <WH1569> four <WH702> days <WH3117> in the year. <WH8141>
